links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
James Grime and Brady Haran, 3 is everywhere - Numberphile
formula: a(n) ~ n. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 28 2012For m >= 1, a(10^m - 9^m) = 10^m-7, a(10^m - 9^m + 1) = 10^m + 3. - _Robert Israel_, Jan 11 2016
maple: M:= 3: # to get all terms of up to M digitsB:= {3}: A:= {3}:for i from 2 to M do   B:= map(t -> seq(10*t+j,j=0..9),B) union      {seq(10*x+3,x=10^(i-2)..10^(i-1)-1)}:   A:= A union B;od:sort(convert(A,list));# _Robert Israel_, Jan 11 2016
prog: (Haskell)a011533 n = a011533_list !! (n-1)a011533_list = filter ((elem '3') . show) [0..]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 10 2015(MAGMA) [n: n in [0..500] | 3 in Intseq(n)]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jan 11 2016(PARI) isok(n) = {my(d=digits(n)); for (k=1, #d, if (d[k] == 3, return (1)));} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jan 11 2016
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
